title: Farmers' protest: Security heightened at Haryana-Punjab Shambhu border
desc: Heightened security marks the Haryana-Punjab Shambhu Border as Haryana Police dismantles barriers to allow farmer movement. Patiala SSP assures the road will be cleared without using force. Several farmer leaders face detainment, prompting mixed reactions from politicians and farmer organizations. Former Punjab CM Channi and BJP leader Bajwa criticize government's actions amid ongoing talks.

title: Bill Gates tries his hand at pesticide sprayer made by startup to ease farmers' woes
desc: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates tested a new pesticide sprayer at the Indian Agricultural Research Institute in New Delhi. Developed by engineer Yogesh Gawande, the innovative device helps farmers spray chemicals over multiple crop rows efficiently. Successful in India and gaining traction in Africa, the sprayer reduces the burden of carrying heavy tanks and adjusts for different plant heights.

title: All countrymen should stand with farmers: Bajrang Punia on ongoing protest at Shambhu border
desc: Olympic wrestler Bajrang Punia criticizes the government for arresting protesting farmers at Shambhu Border, labeling it a betrayal. He accuses the government of pretending to engage in dialogue while trying to suppress the farmers' movement. Punia urges citizens to support farmers against what he sees as oppressive actions by both the Central and Punjab governments.

title: Farmer leaders detained as Punjab clears protest sites
desc: Several farmer leaders in Punjab were detained by police while heading to protest sites following inconclusive talks with Union ministers regarding a minimum support price (MSP) guarantee law for crops. The detentions, aiming to clear blockade sites, sparked strong reactions from opposition leaders who accused the state and Union governments of being complicit.

title: Police detain Jagjit Singh Dallewal, others as they remove protesting farmers from Shambhu Border
desc: Punjab Police removed farmers from the Shambhu and Khanauri borders who were protesting against the central government’s policies. Key farmer leaders were detained, leading to backlash from various political figures. Punjab Minister Harpal Singh Cheema stressed that protests should be directed at the central government in Delhi.

title: Karnataka assembly passes resolution against Centre's Waqf Bill amid BJP walkout
desc: The Karnataka assembly passed a resolution opposing the Centre's Waqf (Amendment) Bill while BJP members walked out in protest. The ruling government urged immediate withdrawal of the bill, citing constitutional violations, while the BJP accused it of Muslim appeasement and ignoring farmers' issues.

title: Par panel asks govt to examine mechanism of determining milk prices by procurement agencies
desc: A parliamentary panel urges the government to review milk price determination to ensure farmers get better returns. It highlights that milk price inflation is lower than food inflation, affecting farmer income. The panel also calls for addressing milk adulteration and explains the suspension of the Delhi Milk Scheme license by FSSAI.

title: Cabinet approves revised national program for dairy development
desc: The Union Cabinet, chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, approved the Revised National Program for Dairy Development with a budget increase to Rs 2790 crore for 2021-2026. Aimed at modernizing and expanding dairy infrastructure, the program targets better market access and higher incomes for farmers, alongside generating employment.

title: Telangana govt presents Rs 3.05 lakh cr budget for 2025-26, allots Rs 56k cr for '6 poll guarantees'
desc: The Congress government in Telangana presented a Rs 3.05 lakh crore budget for 2025-26, focusing on welfare and development. Major allocations include Rs 56,000 crore for six poll guarantees and substantial funds for agriculture, education, and rural development. The budget aims for a balanced and equitable resource distribution, with a vision to expand the state economy significantly.

title: Onion and soyabean farmers demand measures to boost exports
desc: As onion and soyabean prices decline in India, industry and farmer groups urge the government for support measures such as reducing onion export duty and providing incentives for exporting soybean meal. Despite earlier import duty hikes on cooking oils, soyabean prices remain below the minimum support levels, impacting farmers' profitability. Onion exports also witnessed a 52% drop this year.

title: Ivory Coast's mid-crop cocoa output expected to drop around 40% due to long drought, exporters say
desc: Farmers expect production between 280,000 and 300,000 metric tons, down from last season's 500,000 tons.

title: Centre with farmers without any discrimination, says Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan
desc: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan assured that the Centre would support farmers from all states during natural disasters, without discrimination. Modi govt will stick to its promise of ensuring farmers' welfare, the minister said.

title: Trump Derangement Syndrome Bill: What do Minnesota Republican Senators want? Everything we know
desc: Five Republican senators in Minnesota have proposed a bill to classify ‘Trump derangement syndrome’ as a mental illness. The bill describes symptoms as hostility towards Trump and his supporters.

title: Himachal Pradesh Budget Highlights: Milk prices hiked, stress on eco-tourism, and more in 2025
desc: Himachal Pradesh CM Sukhvinder Sukhu's 2025 budget announces a price hike for cow and buffalo milk to support dairy farmers, the creation of a Spice Park in Hamirpur, development of tea estates into eco-tourism hubs, and promotion of religious tourism. Other highlights include a GST compensation stop, increased wages for rural workers, and empowering 1 lakh farmers towards natural farming.

title: UP gaushalas to become self-reliant; use cow dung, urine to promote natural farming
desc: Uttar Pradesh plans to make cow shelters self-reliant by utilising cow dung and urine for eco-friendly farming, enhancing soil fertility, and benefiting farmers economically. The state aims to promote natural cow-based agriculture, improve cattle nutrition, and support sustainable farming practices, integrating local resources. Over 7,700 shelters and various government schemes are in place to support these initiatives.

title: Can you legally own a train? This Ludhiana farmer did and that too with court orders
desc: In a rare legal case, Ludhiana farmer Sampuran Singh briefly became the owner of the Swarna Shatabdi Express due to an unresolved compensation dispute with Indian Railways. The issue began when his land was acquired for the Ludhiana-Chandigarh railway line in 2007. While other farmers received Rs 71 lakh per acre, Singh was initially compensated only Rs 25 lakh. After years of legal battles, the court increased his compensation to Rs 1.7 crore per acre, but the railways failed to pay the full amount.

title: Why Trump is singling out South Africa and accusing it of being anti-white and anti-American
desc: The Trump administration has expelled South Africa's ambassador, accusing the South African government of anti-white policies and supporting groups like Hamas and Iran. Secretary of State Marco Rubio criticized Ambassador Ebrahim Rasool, deeming him a "race-baiting politician." The decision follows executive orders cutting US funding over alleged discriminatory practices and controversial foreign alignments.

title: Farmer suicide figures in Maharashtra worrying; Centre should come up with policy, says Sharad Pawar
desc: Sharad Pawar has raised concerns about farmer suicides in Marathwada and Vidarbha and urged the Centre to devise a policy to assist farmers. He also mentioned the potential use of AI in improving sugarcane farming and highlighted the misuse of power by some elected individuals in Beed.

title: Tamil Nadu announces special package for paddy growers, international exposure visit for farmers
desc: Tamil Nadu government will implement a Rs 102 crore package to boost paddy area and food grain production across non-Cauvery Delta districts, and allocate Rs 58 crore for similar efforts in the Delta districts. The package includes subsidies for machine planting, quality seeds distribution, and farmer exposure visits to Japan, China, and Vietnam.

title: Narrow escape for Rakesh Tikait as car collides with nilgai in UP's Muzaffarnagar
desc: Rakesh Tikait, Bharatiya Kisan Union leader, narrowly escaped an accident in Muzaffarnagar when a nilgai collided with his vehicle near Meerpur bypass road. Tikait emerged unhurt from the incident. Following the collision, Uttar Pradesh minister Kapil Dev Agarwal and Muzaffarnagar MP Harendra Singh Malik visited Tikait to check on him.

title: BJP rule in Maharashtra worse than Aurangzeb's time: Sanjay Raut
desc: Sanjay Raut criticizes the BJP rule in Maharashtra, claiming it is worse than Aurangzeb's era as farmers, unemployed individuals, and women are resorting to suicides. He argued that the current government is causing these issues, not the long-buried Mughal ruler.

title: Congress highlights recommendations of Parliament panel calling for legal guarantee for MSP
desc: The parliamentary standing committee has recommended a legal guarantee for MSP, loan waivers, and extending MSP to organic crops. Financial support for crop residue management, universal crop insurance for small farmers, and renaming the Agriculture Department to include farm labourers' welfare have also been suggested.

title: India blocks United States' farmers, claims America's Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick
desc: America's Commerce Secretary, Howard Lutnick, stated that India blocks U.S. farmers' products and emphasized that President Trump aims to negotiate with countries like India that hinder access to global markets. He praised the UK and Mexico for avoiding retaliation against U.S. tariffs but warned that countries upsetting Trump could face severe responses.

title: Tur procurement under Price Support Scheme reaches 1.31 lakh tons: Agriculture Ministry
desc: The Centre has procured 1.31 lakh tonnes of tur under the Price Support Scheme for the 2024-25 Kharif season, benefiting over 89,000 farmers across five states. Procurement will commence soon in other regions, with approvals for masur and urad as well. This initiative aims for self-sufficiency in pulses by 2029.

title: Tur procurement begins in major states; Govt to procure 100% of Tur, Urad and Masur
desc: Tur (Arhar) dal procurement has commenced in major producing states such as Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat, Karnataka, Maharashtra, and Telangana, with 1.31 LMT already procured by March 11, 2025. This benefits 89,219 farmers. The government plans to expand procurement efforts to other states soon under the PM-AASHA Scheme.

title: Govt ready to include farmers in PM Kisan Samman Nidhi who are not part of it yet: Agri minister
desc: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced that the government is prepared to offer Rs 6,000 annual cash benefit under the PM Kisan Samman Nidhi to all eligible farmers not yet included. State governments are urged to help identify these farmers and ensure they receive the benefit without delay.

title: USDA cuts over $1 billion in funding for schools, local food purchases
desc: The U.S. Agriculture Department cut over $1 billion in funds for programs aiding schools and food banks in purchasing from local farms and ranches. These cuts are part of efforts to reduce federal spending under President Trump's administration. The decision has led to concerns among farmers and food organizations, who are now cutting staff and halting investments.

title: India produced record rice, wheat, maize in 2024-25, estimates Centre
desc: India achieved record rice, wheat, and maize production in the 2024-25 kharif season, according to the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare's second advance estimates. Kharif foodgrains production reached 1,663.91 lakh tonnes, while rabi foodgrains amounted to 1,645.27 lakh tonnes. These estimates provide significant insights into the country's agricultural output for major crops.

title: Farmers put plans, investments on hold under Trump USDA spending freeze
desc: USDA's grant freeze under the Trump administration has left farmers across the U.S. facing financial instability, halting projects and risking bankruptcy. Farmers like Nate Powell-Palm in Montana are directly impacted, with significant investments on hold. The freeze, along with new tariffs, is straining the agricultural sector while USDA and White House reviews continue.
